Secrets of Grindea Mod, HDR, Ultrawide (21:9), Super Ultrawide (32:9), AMD 
FSR 3 & DLSS Support Details
text: Secrets of Grindea Mod, HDR, Ultrawide (21:9), Super Ultrawide (32:9), AMD FSR 3 & DLSS Support Details After over a decade-long wait, Secrets of Grindea is finally here in all its glory. Developer Pixel Ferret released Version 1.0 of the game on February 29, 2024, officially marking the end of a thirteen-year-long development. Suffice it to say, there’s a lot of excitement for this game. Plus, now that it’s finally out, a lot of players want to know if they can enjoy it with mods, HDR, ultrawide, super ultrawide, ADM FSR 3, and DLSS. It’s only evident that a newly released title like Secrets of Grindea will warrant questions like these. Every player has their own preference when it comes to how they want to play a game. Some like to mod their games, while others prefer to enjoy their games on big and wide screens with everything turned to max. And for all that, it’s important to know what kind of features a game supports. So, does Secrets of Grindea have modding, HDR, ultrawide, super ultrawide, AMD FSR 3, and DLSS support? Well, let’s go ahead and find out.  At the time of publishing this, Secrets of Grindea doesn’t have official mod support. Fans have been asking for mod support for quite a while, but the developers have refrained from doing that. Furthermore, the game does have Steam Workshop support, but unfortunately, it’s limited to translation and nothing else. This isn’t to say that there isn’t a dedicated modding scene for Secrets of Grindea. In fact, there are a handful of fans who have been working on adding proper third-party mod support for a long time. However, because there’s no modding APU for the game, it’s been a challenge to properly mod Secrets of Grindea. But there’s a ray of hope! With Secrets of Grindea officially released, there’s a high chance that we will see official mod support in the future. But for now, there’s nothing much to do when it comes to modding in Secrets of Grindea. Besides that, the game also doesn’t have native HDR support currently. However, you can try using Windows 11’s Auto-HDR or third-party tools like Special K or autohdr_force and see if any of them work out. If none of these are of help, then you will have to wait for the developers to add in proper HDR support, like some players are doing for ultrawide and super ultrawide. Currently, if you play the game in 21:9 or 32:9 aspect ratios, the game just stretches the image on the screen, resulting in bad visuals. However, developers are aware of this and have promised to address it in future updates. Secrets of Grindea also doesn’t have AMD FSR 3 or DLSS support. However, this is to be expected. The game isn’t a resource hog at all and can run even on the most potato PC out there. So, adding upscaling options will just overcomplicate things when it doesn’t need them at all in the first place. Well, that’s all the information we have on this.
